location.merchant_description_html: Poppi’s Pizza cranks out delectable thin-crust pies as if they are the leader in a “No crust left behind” campaign. Their signature slices are undeniable from the soft, melted cheese tip to the crispy, buttery crust. And, the menu provides tons of topping options for the space in between. I highly suggest the Ortolana which drops fresh spinach, artichokes, olives and feta atop the sauce surface. With a single bite you find find yourself uttering “Poppi’s is the best pizza ever had.” You’re not alone. The staff actually keeps a tally. If that phrase is said in the shop, a tally gets added to a poster out back. Needless to say, they’ve had to invest in bigger posters.

“Farm to Table” was so 2010. It’s 2012, people! Let’s get specific! As the folks at BB Ranch Butchers say, start thinking “Ranch to Plate”. Former chef & caterer William von Schneidau wants to appease your night sweats, promising cuts of organic, grass-fed meat & fowl all raised on local farms. You’re given all the info on your purchase of locally raised meat, right down to its diet. Train for a meat Sommelier license by appreciating the subtle notes in the melon-fed pork. Seeking a little more distance? BB’s also has homemade sausage, jerky, and marinades. Let’s. Get. Primal.

Amazing Hot Dogs and Burgers...and the best Fries you've ever had!    And we're BYOB!     Plenty of veggie options, too.

Cool Dog, the gourmet hot dog and burger cafe, takes familiar American food and adorns it with deliciously unexpected toppings. Whether it’s the fried egg, cheese and bacon on the Jersey Shore Breakfast Dog or the Jack Daniels glaze on the Tennessee Angus Burger, your taste buds are sure to be shocked...in a good way. If you want to prove that your bite is bigger than your bark, attack a ½ lb. Blazing Homewrecker. This monstrosity holds every kick, zing and spice in the book. Baked beans, jalapenos and onions sizzle in a mix of spicy red pepper relish and “Kaboom Sauce.” Ay Chihuahua! And don't forget our award-winning fries!

When you want hearty authentic Italian food, the post-meal espresso is an after thought. When you want a perfectly delicate foamy cappuccino, any nearby cellophane-wrapped sandwich will do. At Piccolo, there’s no need to sell yourself short. Try the Green Focaccia Panini with homemade pesto, mozz, basil, tomatoes, and arugula. Or Grandmother’s Meatballs with tomato sauce, basil and green peas (you’ll see why pasta isn’t included.) Dip a biscotti or four in your Macchiato, and bask in Italian glory.

When it comes to food you put in your body, Pitopia is pro-gluttony. They fill homemade pita bread with moist, crunchy falafel, then you take the reins. Choose from a rainbow of fifteen unlimited toppings, like tabouli, chickpeas, and tomato salads, red and white cabbage, and cauliflower. Next, sauce your creation with one of eight choices like tahini, garlic, pesto, and cilantro. How many possible combinations? You could do the math, or if you’re like me, try them all.

Maybe college students have this whole “life” thing down... It’s about new experiences, like pineapple on your sandwich. Try Sarducci’s Honolulu Chicken Breast Sub, spilling with pineapple and red onions, and a breeze of mayo-ranch-swiss. And maybe 2PM really is the new 6AM... On weekends, breakfast takes its rightful place as an all-day affair where Sausage & Egg Breakfast Subs rule from open to close. Sarducci’s serves crepes, like the Hong Kong: decked with chocolate-drizzled strawberries, a trail of cornflakes and a smack of ice cream. One bite, and the college mentality starts to make a little more sense. UW students... we feel ya.

So THIS is what party bus is! Vibrant colors beam from LCD screens as Latin music pulls those little strings on your hips and toes. You’re about to enter a whirlwind of Latin American flavor fusion. Taquero Fusion is Chicago’s taco truck, with influences from the spiciest spheres of flavor from Puerto Rico to Colombia. $8 gets you two tacos (we suggest the simmering steak), your choice of a zesty slaw, and one side item (jalapeno rice!) Check them out on Twitter @TaqueroFusion!

The BeefEater lurks in the depths of The Artisan Cellar’s cafe. The aroma of its accomplice, Illy Coffee, lures customers past the wine racks to the cafe counter. Lunchtime brings a dozen panini-ed sandwiches, hot soup and a hoard of BeefEaters, with curls of red onion and a coating of horseradish cream, all its layers melded together with aged white cheddar. Tame it outside on the patio with the Mixed Green Salad of the day (check Facebook for creations!) Fresh air and a view of the river are perfectly relaxing even without a glass of wine (you can’t buy it on LevelUp anyway...just the cafe goods!)

Celebrity stylist Danie is an expert in the essence of healthy hair. Danie is serving up hairdo happiness. Epic transformations take place in her chair: short locks made long and luxurious with the addition of extensions. A splash of color to bring out the uniqueness in your eyes. If your damaged hair is crying out for a little love, go for the Sweet Treatment. It’s 100% natural and infuses your locks with the vitamins and oils it needs to grow. Leave the salon feeling brand new. But before you go, how about a Beyonce hair flip for good measure?

Zaytoon Wraps sets the scene for a flavorful Mediterranean lunch in the Mission. The small ensemble menu features Falafel and Shawarma Wraps, destined to please any crowd. The lead characters really connect with the audience when it’s revealed that the everything from the local lamb to the Bay Area-baked pitas have strong ties to San Francisco. Toward the end of the plot, it looks like the Mazza Platter is going to steal the show. Stocked with dolmas, hummus, baba ghanoush, AND tabouleh, it seemed like the favorite. That was until we found out that Zaytoon carries a wide selection of gourmet olive oils. Surprise ending. CUT. That’s a wrap on lunch.

At Hotwire Online Coffee House, find instant gratification: they’ve got WiFi, comps and even a printer and scanner. But instant access can only go so far. In terms of coffee, they’ll pour it, foam it, draw it and roast it, but it will NEVER be prepared by a simple push of a button. Roasts from countries like Kenya and Brazil need extra love. That may come in the form of a marshmallow Peep maxin’ and relaxin’ on the foamy waves of your morning mocha (totally something to tweet about.) Try their Textwire program: text your drink order and it’ll be ready when you arrive! Man, these phones do fancy things these days...

Ever get caught with your hand in the cookie jar? Well, it’s hard to keep your hands to yourself at Sweet Auburn Bakery. They’ve got a seemingly endless amount of delicious, old-fashioned desserts that would make even your grandma jealous. From smooth Sweet Potato Cheesecake and crisp Apple Danishes to fresh Muffins and Cookies, there's no better feeling than spoiling your dinner. Heck, you're an adult, I think you just found dinner ... and breakfast.

I don’t know why I always feel like an explorer when I eat at Ruby of Siam, but when I sit down, my research cap goes on. Each shrimp I unearth in a spoonful of Tom Yum soup is like a rose quartz-colored piece of perfection. Roasted Duck Curry (served in, yes, a duck-shaped boat) proffers intrigues like grape, peapod and pineapple. A bite of Yellow Curry surprises me with textural invention: was that a sweet potato? To finish my plate will help me deduce the answer, so I’d better do so. For the sake of science!

The term “DIY” is not only reserved for ill-fated bedazzling projects. It also aligns with the delicious protocol at Mac Kelley’s. Here, diners are invited to design their own meals from an extensive buffet of fresh options. Test the vertical limit of salad bowls with heaps of romaine, glistening green peppers and crumbles of cheese. Build a sandwich up from a blank slice of bread, dressing it with fresh-sliced deli meat, and zesty toppings. You can even mix and match hearty entrees with delectable sides like macaroni and cheese and rice pilaf. Gourmet has never been this hands-on!

We just caught wind of a new snack craze. The source of the stir? Core Bistro in the Seattle Municipal Tower! Curious, you hit the scene to investigate. You bob by the Sandwich section, where sauteed onions are being placed atop a juicy Honey Bourbon Pork-which. You weave through the salad line where romaine is being tossed for a Caesar. Then you see them: the Skews. Delicious meat hunks and vegetable chunks sizzle on the grill. Your eyes dance over the ingredients from skewer end to skewer end in silent song: Beef, pepper, broccoli, beef, pepper, broccoli! Snack, secured. At $1.99 a Skew, there’s no reason why every afternoon can’t feel like a summer BBQ.

Just when I thought that the art of the afternoon stroll could not be perfected, I ran into Mudbar Coffee Cart at 1230 Columbia Street. Literally, bowled into it. The green awnings of the wood wagon appeared out of no where. I clawed at the counter to catch my balance, meeting the gaze of Jen, a smiley barista. We chatted for a few minutes. It turns out the cart is stationed here every week day from 7:00AM-11:30AM. How have I never seen this before? Jen, sent me on my way with a bold white mocha and a delightfully flaky pastry. As I cruised the cobblestones of Little Italy, perfect snack in hand, I took off my watch and slipped it into my pocket. Today’s not a day for the limitations of lunch breaks.

When darkness hits the streets of Seattle, I’m brought out by the Flair Taco truck. While I’ve got my heart set on a Beef Taco, I find myself prowling the street with vegetarian taco trekkers as well, searching for Tofu Adobado Tacos with a chili kick. At 36th & Phinney, the real meat eaters have already arrived at the truck. They’re devouring Mexican Hot Dogs.  The beef franks wrapped in bacon are smothered in sauteed onions and pickled jalapenos. After every Burrito and Quesadilla is gone, we all howl at the moon... nah, really we roll ourselves home. The former sounded cooler, that’s all.

Game on. Hungry for finger food, you sprint over to Nick’s Crispy Tacos. Their statistical reputation is widely hailed: 18 types of tacos and burritos. Beer and margaritas by the pitcher AND the freshest guacamole in town. The interior decor includes red velvet walls and dangling chandeliers, but you don’t fumble. It belongs to Rouge, the night club that the place turns into after dark. Right now it’s all about pristine HDTV views. Besides, jerseys look straight up regal against velvet. Before you know it, you’re sacked by the Pescado Tacos. Baja-style fried fish in a corn tortilla and topped with salsa, lime, mayonnaise, cilantro, cabbage and onions. Defeat never tasted so good.

Freshii is kicking fast, fresh food up a notch with their mantra to 'Eat. Energize.' If you've visited Freshii lately you may have noticed some changes. The new bold décor, digital menu boards and a new menu to boot. Freshii is providing guests more of the things they want. Like? More flavorful meal options, new ingredients and dressings, less filler, packaging that's easier to enjoy and a menu of 20 new chef-designed creations that are simply delicious! One thing that hasn't changed? Their commitment to your health. Freshii is focused on nutritious meals that energize and help you live the lifestyle you want. Stop by 230 Bush St. or 4 Embarcadero Center M-F from 7am-4pm for Breakfast, Lunch and all your snack needs. Click the website below to order online and have food ready when you arrive!

High Spot calls itself a deli, but don’t let that fool you; they do so much more. For starters, fresh made Pizza is offered daily. So is a Chicken Salsa Wrap stuffed with steamy rice, an honorable hybrid of awesomeness that combines the best elements of a sandwich and a burrito in one fell swoop! The Cubano is not to be missed, either. On crispy french bread, ham is piled high and topped with spicy chipotle mayo, mustard, and sour pickles, leaving grinning you ear to ear.

Can Tom cook? It’s the question on every Walthamian’s mind. He claims to create delicious, traditional Thai, Korean, Japanese, Szechuan and Vietnamese favorites, but there’s only one way to find out...go 3 rounds with Tom. Round 1: Crab Rangoons. Tom’s version is proof that every meal should begin with a little crisp-cream-crab. Round 2: Tom Yam Soup. The Thai sour soup is spiced with herbs, mushrooms and a surprising kick of lime juice. For Round 3: Squid Disco from the “House Adventures” menu section. Tender quid is gently sauteed with chicken, mushrooms and veggies. Once you hit the prik-pao basil sauce, you’ll be saying, “Man, Tom CAN cook.”

Noble Square is home to Chicago’s newest flavor sensation: Nini’s Deli. Owner Jose Riesco, who runs the shop with his wife, Julie, is part-Cuban and part-Lebanese. He incorporates different pieces of his heritage in the dishes he cranks out, making for never-before-tasted flavor collaborations. For starters, he serves the classic Cuban dish Ropa Vieja in sandwich form. Atop crusty bread, shredded flank steak mingles with plantains and beans in a rich tomato sauce. Nini’s also sways Middle Eastern with a rave-worthy falafel sandwich, doused in homemade tahini. Swing by, say hi and experience a global taste test first-hand.

Most meal options look like dweebs compared to the all-natural menu at Calista Superfoods. The options at this lunch-time go-to are more powerful than a locomotive, hence the “Super” reference, and the others, ehhh, they’re stuck at a desk with sweaty palms still trying to figure out how to score with Lois Lane. Try the Teriyaki Chicken Wrap packed with mixed veggies, brown rice and sesame seeds. With a sweet Berry Blast Smoothie on the side, you’ll leave feeling full, not weighed down. All natural just feels better.

Recently, I’ve somehow earned the reputation of being deranged. The truth of the matter is that I just get a little carried away when I catch the garlic-y scent of smooth Hummus as I enter Mediterranean Grill. I hear them whisper. “Look at how she strokes her Pita. She’s about as nutty as the Walnut Baklava.” But when I sink my teeth into a warm Shish Kabob Wrap, packed with lean cuts of marinated tenderloin, crisp lettuce and a lavish layer of tahini, my system goes into overdrive. Some people leave in a hurry when I start talking to myself, leaving behind their precious Gyros. Welp, more for me.

OTTO serves gourmet, specialty pizza by the slice or whole pie. Serving discerning pizza fans in New England since 2009.

Try our award-winning mashed potato, bacon & scallion pie!

At MexiCali Burrito Co., you’ll need 3 things: a napkin covered surface, a fork and a screwdriver. Why? The Big Sur is Boston’s biggest burrito. Beans and rice mix with two fillings of your choice (try the Achiote Citrus Chicken and Barbacoa.) Not impressed? Get this: these ingredients are so abundant that they need not one, but TWO tortillas. Top that with all the guac-gallo-cheesy-sour-cream you desire. As long as you don’t traffic-jam your burrito bites and Tortilla Chips, you shouldn’t need that jaw-unhinging screwdriver...we hope.

Sunglasses are a must when approaching Pike Place Chowder... because all those trophies are so dang shiny. Their Seafood Bisque placed 1st in Rhode Island’s Great Chowder Cookoff three years straight before they were placed in the Hall of Fame! This ocean extravaganza is simmering with Pacific cod, Northwestern salmon, Oregon bay shrimp and crab in a tomato-based broth. Enjoy it in a massive sourdough breadbowl tank. Check out their other chowders and seafood favorites, too. New England Clam Chowder done better than the northeast natives? They won’t toot their own shrimp boat horn, but we will!

My morning doesn’t start until I’ve gotten caffeine. If my joe comes with an attitudey barista... Watch out office. King Kong approaches. Luckily, I head to Christine’s Coffee & Co., a coffee cart boasting incredible customer service. Instead of grunts and lukewarm java shoved my way, I’m greeted with a smile, a recollection of my usual(“You go for the Americano right? Comin’ right up!”) and well wishes for an awesome day. The coffee is hot and bold, but has a sweet undertone, much like Christine herself. Her cart at 6th & B Street stands up to some big-time coffee stars. #Underdog (nicer dog.)
